ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend it to other students - it provided a good basis of a lot of different aspects of pharmacology.

Pharm I is an overview of drug action, design and metabolism in the beginning, and then it goes into specific medications used in the treatment of diseases like cancer, athsma, infections and transplant rejection. I would recommend the course to a student who knows they are interested in pharmacology and is unsure of what disease model they would like to work with, since it gives a good overview of hot areas in pharmacology. However, if they know what disease they would like to work with it might not be as useful.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The introductory lectures were the most helpful since they gave an overview of drug discovery and I would like to work on identifying good drug targets. This will help me understand how drugs are designed to help look for better targets. Also, knowing how some drugs are used in the lab was helpful. However, I plan on working on drugs affecting the central nervous system, which was not covered.
